intro: Botrychium formosanum, commonly known as the Formosan moonwort, is a rare fern species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Osmundaceae and is characterized by its unique, moon-shaped spore cases. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its fronds are delicate and often have a distinct, undulating appearance. Botrychium formosanum plays an important ecological role in its habitat, contributing to the biodiversity of understory plant communities.
